comments.body: You shouldn't need to double up on `\` in the docs. The Python doc string is prefixed with `r` so no escaping necessary.

Interesting, I thought that was why on the website the `\`s aren't showing up.
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/modules/win_hosts_module.html#synopsis

Looks like a potential bug in our doc generation for synopsis, we can see the values in the module options table are fine based on [win_copy](https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/modules/win_copy_module.html) https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/modules/windows/win_copy.py#L39. Let's leave it as you have it for now as it's better to have at least something there even if it changes in the future.

Sounds good. I tested the HTML output with the extra `\`s using `make webdocs` and the synopsis displayed correctly. output: ```html
  • Manages hosts file entries on Windows.
  • Maps IPv4 or IPv6 addresses to canonical names.
  • Adds, removes, or sets cname records for ip and hostname pairs.
  • Modifies %windir%\system32\drivers\etc\hosts.
```
